com.google.tts
Class TTS

java.lang.Object
  com.google.tts.TTS

public class TTS
extends java.lang.Object

Synthesizes speech from text. This abstracts away the complexities of using the TTS service such as setting up the IBinder connection and handling RemoteExceptions, etc. The TTS should always be safe the use; if the user does not have the necessary TTS apk installed, the behavior is that all calls to the TTS act as no-ops.

Constructor Detail

TTS

public TTS(Context context,
           TTS.InitListener callback,
           boolean displayInstallMessage)
The constructor for the TTS.

Parameters:
context - The context
callback - The InitListener that should be called when the TTS has initialized successfully.
displayInstallMessage - Boolean indicating whether or not an installation prompt should be displayed to users who do not have the TTS library. If this is true, a generic alert asking the user to install the TTS will be used. If you wish to specify the exact message of that prompt, please use TTS(Context context, InitListener callback, TTSVersionAlert alert) as the constructor instead.

TTS

           TTS.InitListener callback,
           TTSVersionAlert alert)
The constructor for the TTS.

Parameters:
context - The context
callback - The InitListener that should be called when the TTS has initialized successfully.
alert - The TTSVersionAlert to be displayed
Method Detail

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down the TTS. It is good practice to call this in the onDestroy method of the Activity that is using the TTS so that the TTS is stopped cleanly.

addSpeech

public void addSpeech(java.lang.String text,
                      java.lang.String packagename,
                      int resourceId)
Adds a mapping between a string of text and a sound resource in a package.

Parameters:
text - Example: "south_south_east"
packagename - Pass the packagename of the application that contains the resource. If the resource is in your own application (this is the most common case), then put the packagename of your application here.
Example: "com.google.marvin.compass"
The packagename can be found in the AndroidManifest.xml of your application.

<manifest xmlns:android="..." package="com.google.marvin.compass">

resourceId - Example: R.raw.south_south_east
See Also:
#TTS.speak(String text, int queueMode, String[] params)

addSpeech

public void addSpeech(java.lang.String text,
                      java.lang.String filename)
Adds a mapping between a string of text and a sound file. Using this, it is possible to add custom pronounciations for text.

Parameters:
text - The string of text
filename - The full path to the sound file (for example: "/sdcard/mysounds/hello.wav")

speak

public void speak(java.lang.String text,
                  int queueMode,
                  java.lang.String[] params)
Speaks the string using the specified queuing strategy and speech parameters. Note that the speech parameters are not universally supported by all engines and will be treated as a hint. The TTS library will try to fulfill these parameters as much as possible, but there is no guarantee that the voice used will have the properties specified.

Parameters:
text - The string of text to be spoken.
queueMode - The queuing strategy to use. Use 0 for no queuing, and 1 for queuing.
params - The array of speech parameters to be used. Currently, only params[0] is defined - it is for setting the type of voice if the engine allows it. Possible values are "VOICE_MALE", "VOICE_FEMALE", and "VOICE_ROBOT". Note that right now only the pre-recorded voice has this support - this setting has no effect on eSpeak.

playEarcon

public void playEarcon(java.lang.String earcon,
                       int queueMode,
                       java.lang.String[] params)
Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

Parameters:
earcon - The earcon that should be played
queueMode - 0 for no queue (interrupts all previous utterances), 1 for queued
params - An ArrayList of parameters.

playEarcon

public void playEarcon(TTSEarcon earcon,
                       int queueMode,
                       java.lang.String[] params)
Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

Parameters:
earcon - The TTSEarcon that should be played
queueMode - 0 for no queue (interrupts all previous utterances), 1 for queued
params - An ArrayList of parameters.

isSpeaking

public boolean isSpeaking()
Returns whether or not the TTS is busy speaking.

Returns:
Whether or not the TTS is busy speaking.

stop

public void stop()
Stops speech from the TTS.

Returns the version number of the TTS library that the user has installed.

Returns:
The version number of the TTS library that the user has installed.

setEngine

public void setEngine(TTSEngine selectedEngine)
Sets the TTS engine to be used.

Parameters:
selectedEngine - The TTS engine that should be used.

setSpeechRate

public void setSpeechRate(int speechRate)
Sets the speech rate for the TTS engine. Note that the speech rate is not universally supported by all engines and will be treated as a hint. The TTS library will try to use the specified speech rate, but there is no guarantee. Currently, this will change the speech rate for the espeak engine, but it has no effect on any pre-recorded speech.

Parameters:
speechRate - The speech rate for the TTS engine.

setLanguage

public void setLanguage(java.lang.String language)
Sets the language for the TTS engine. Note that the language is not universally supported by all engines and will be treated as a hint. The TTS library will try to use the specified language, but there is no guarantee. Currently, this will change the language for the espeak engine, but it has no effect on any pre-recorded speech.

Parameters:
language - The language to be used. The languages are specified by their IETF language tags as defined by BCP 47. This is the same standard used for the lang attribute in HTML. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag

synthesizeToFile

public boolean synthesizeToFile(java.lang.String text,
                                java.lang.String[] params,
                                java.lang.String filename)
Speaks the given text using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

Parameters:
text - The String of text that should be synthesized
params - An ArrayList of parameters. The first element of this array controls the type of voice to use.
filename - The string that gives the full output filename; it should be something like "/sdcard/myappsounds/mysound.wav".
Returns:
A boolean that indicates if the synthesis succeeded

showVersionAlert

public void showVersionAlert()
Displays an alert that prompts users to install the TTS that is available on the Market. This is useful if the application expects a newer version of the TTS than what the user has.

isInstalled

public static boolean isInstalled(Context ctx)
Checks if the TTS service is installed or not

Returns:
A boolean that indicates whether the TTS service is installed
